thread.title: Danny Dyer's aunt urges him to "sort himself out" and save marriage as EastEnders future hangs in balance
thread.title_full: Danny Dyer's aunt urges him to "sort himself out" and save marriage as EastEnders future hangs in balance

author: Halina Watts
title: Danny Dyer's aunt urges him to "sort himself out" and save marriage as EastEnders future hangs in balance
text:
Showbiz Danny Dyer's aunt urges him to "sort himself out" and save marriage as EastEnders future hangs in balance Danny’s aunt ­Debbie Meakin told the Sunday Mirror: “He needs to take a step back and look at his life. He’s got a lovely family – his children and his wife" Share Danny Dyer is in South Africa after soap bosses gave him time off from playing pub landlord Mick Carter (Photo: Getty) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Troubled Danny Dyer ’s family urged the star to “sort himself out” yesterday as fears grow he may quit EastEnders to save his marriage. 
Danny, 39, faces claims he cheated on wife Jo Mas, sending lewd messages and a photo of his manhood to another woman nine weeks before they wed last September. 
Yesterday Danny’s aunt ­Debbie Meakin told the Sunday Mirror: “He needs to take a step back and look at his life. He’s got a lovely family – his children and his wife. It’s just a shame. 
“It’s just same old, same old. How he acts doesn’t just affect him, it affects his wife and kids.” Dani Dyer and her father Danny Dyer (Photo: FameFlynet) 
Danny’s daughter Dani, 20, found the woman her father allegedly sexted on Facebook and in direct messages branded her “slag slag slag”, threatening: “If I see you I’ll hurt ya.” 
Another family member, who did not wish to be named, added: “He’s nothing like people think. 
"He’s got different values and different attitudes to other members of the family and there’s a long- running rift between some of us.” 
Dad-of-three Danny, who met the woman at a book signing, is in South Africa after soap bosses gave him time off from playing pub landlord Mick Carter. 
They say he has no intention of leaving the show. But another source said: “If quitting the show to give him time to focus on his family is necessary, he will.” 
Friends close to Jo say she is willing to give him another chance if he proves he has kicked his drug and drink demons. 
He told her he is willing to do whatever it takes to save their relationship. Like us on Facebook
